title: Need help identifying this Script font
content:
Hello,

I was wondering if someone can help me identify the name and origin of this font. Thank you in advance for any assistance.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081120221644im_/http:/typophile.com/files/font_envelopments_5611.gif)

 [‹ Problem with Double Quotes in Arno Pro](http://web.archive.org/web/20081120221644/http:/typophile.com/node/47417 "Go to previous forum topic") [Fonts with Beautiful Numerals ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081120221644/http:/typophile.com/node/47383 "Go to next forum topic")
author: predikt

comments.content:
I could be wrong, but it looks like La Portenia made by Aljeandro Paul.

[http://www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000105](http://web.archive.org/web/20081120221644/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000105 "http://www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000105")

[It is](http://web.archive.org/web/20081120221644/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/sudtipos/la_portenia/?sample_text=Denise%20Michele%20Grayson) indeed.

See you in a couple day, Stefan!
